intro: Peckia subspicata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved peckia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Peckia subspicata is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
